com.craftar
Class CraftARCloudRecognition

java.lang.Object
  com.craftar.CraftARCloudRecognition

public abstract class CraftARCloudRecognition
extends java.lang.Object

Module that interacts with the CRS service. It allows to perform searches on the cloud, as well as using the finderMode.

Constructor Detail

CraftARCloudRecognition

public CraftARCloudRecognition()
Method Detail

setRequestBBoxes

public abstract void setRequestBBoxes(boolean value)
Flag to control if you want to retrieve or not the BoundingBoxes for the cloud recognition searches. The Bounding Box defines four corners where the reference image was found in the cloud search.

setEmbedCustom

public abstract void setEmbedCustom(boolean value)
Flag to control whether to embed or not the custom data in the CraftARItem. If true, the custom data will be embedded in the custom field If false, the custom data will only contain a link.

setCollectionToken

public abstract void setCollectionToken(java.lang.String token)
Sets the collection token that will be used for the cloud recognition searches ONLY on finder-mode. Note that this will not affect the searches for single-shot, but just the searches done when startFinding() is called.

setSearchUrl

public abstract void setSearchUrl(java.lang.String url)
Change the default search url. Use this if you want the sdk to interact with other servers instead of interacting directly with the CRS Servers.

Parameters:
url - the url used to perform the search API call
See Also:
http://catchoom.com/documentation/api/recognition/

setConnectUrl

public abstract void setConnectUrl(java.lang.String url)
Change the default connect url to a custom one. Use this if you want the sdk to interact with your servers instead of interacting directly with the CRS

Parameters:
url - the url used to perform the connect API call
See Also:
http://catchoom.com/documentation/api/recognition/

startFinding

public abstract void startFinding()
Start the finder mode search. This will perform continuous searches in the cloud with the token defined by #setCollectionToken(). The default rate of searches per second is 2. You can change this rate by calling #setFinderFramerate() function.

stopFinding

public abstract void stopFinding()
Stop the finder mode search (stop sending queries to the cloud)

connect

public abstract void connect(java.lang.String token)
Call to validate a token. It is not necessary to call either search calls or startFinding(), but you can use it to check if your token is valid and/or to see if the connection to the servers is working.

searchWithImage

public abstract void searchWithImage(java.lang.String token,
                                     CraftARImage image)
Searches the image specified in a collection (used in single-shot mode)

searchWithImage

public abstract void searchWithImage(java.lang.String token,
                                     java.io.File image)
Searches the image specified in a collection.

searchWithImage

public abstract void searchWithImage(java.lang.String token,
                                     Bitmap image)
Searches the image specified in a collection

setResponseHandler

public abstract void setResponseHandler(CraftARResponseHandler handler)
Sets the handler to receive the responses from the server when performing #connect() or #searchWithImage() operations.

setFinderFramerate

public abstract boolean setFinderFramerate(float rate)
Set the number of images that the CraftARImageHandler will receive every second. This is a maximum number of images, and the maximum value allowed is 2/second. Default value is also 2 images/second. Example: If you want your CraftARImageHandler to obtain three images every 2 seconds, then do: setFinderFramerate(3/2f);

setItemsFactory

public abstract void setItemsFactory(CraftARItemFactory factory)
Sets the CraftARItemFactory that will be used to create CraftARItem instances Use this if you are using your own proxy server and you are adding extra information to the CraftARItem class or to extend it.

setCRSConnect

public abstract void setCRSConnect(CRSConnect crsConnect)
Sets the CRSConnect that will be used to perform the calls to the cloud. Use this if you want to take more control about how the calls to the cloud are happening.
